content:
y 30, 2016
												Now for this beast. And man, I thought the first Half Life was amazing. Let me start off by saying this game is an absolute masterpiece. This game completely blows the first Half Life out of the water. Half Life 2 I can say has aged much better than the original Half Life despite Half Life 2 being over 10 years old. While the story seems to come out of nowhere by looking at the end of Half Life, I can say without a doubt the story here is much better than the original and is extremely engaging right off the bat with a stellar intro that grabs your attention. As you walk through just the beginning the world around you looks amaing and is attention grabbing.The atmosphere and design of the world deserves a whole paragraph to itself, so here it is. Much like Star Wars Half Life takes a very used future approach to City 17 and the areas outside of it. Everything in City 17 looks run down and dirty. I love it. City 17 gives off a very unique vibe I have never felt before and is very well put together. As for the area surrounding City 17, I was mainly referring to the endless amount of sewage pipes outside City 17 that have multiple chapters dedicated to them and Highway 17. This whole area helps complelety cement the used future feel of the game. And for Highway 17, I honestly can't describe this section in words, it's a very cool area is really all I can think of to say. As for the VERY unique areas like Nova Prospekt, The Citadel, and Ravenholm, they are all in a whole different category. First off, Nova Prospekt. This area feels and probably looks the closest to present day. It actually feels like a real prison and really gives off the absolute worst place to be like it is trying to give off. Next, The Citadel. Oh man, if there was ever a great place to stage a finale this is it. It gives off a really creepy vibe and is one of the very few things in the game that feels futuristic. The design of the interior of this place is amaing and easily one of the coolest places I have ever seen in a video game. And finally, Ravenholm. Ravenholm, the zombie town, was very creepy to walk through and had me genuinly scared at times it was so well done. I know I have said this before but I have never seen any thing like it.Now for what the original Half Life lacked, characters. Although as of writing this, I have not played Bue Shift, I can say I really liked Barney and thought he was pretty funny at times. As for Eli, I also throughly enjoyed Eli's character and thought he was a very good addition to the game. Dr. Kleiner was also a very good character even tough he did not get much screen time. Now, let's address the elephant in the room I have been neglecting, Alyx. Alyz was a very well written charcter and more or less a sidekick to Gordon as she helped him out whenever she was around. She was a very no nonsense kind of girl and was a kickass and strong chracter, which is hard to see in females in video games.And now, the meat of the game, the gamplay.I'm just gonna say it; this is one of the funnest games of ever played. No joke. Offering a wide variety of weapons all that are good for certain purposes, I never felt that any of the weapons were unnecessary. As for the actual gameplay, it is extremely well done with an awesome mix of both puzzles and action. While somewhat cryptic, none of the puzzles were overy cryptic or annoying and never really hindered gameplay very much. Hell I had more trouble trying to find where to go next in some cases.As for the music in this game my thoughts about it are almost identical to my thought's about the original's. While somewhat campy feeling the music was very good and an absolute treat to hear whenever it very uncommonly came on.The graphics. Oh man the graphics. While the graphics do look very slightly dated, they still hold up suprising well, although I believe this is mostly due to the very realistic looking faces and fluid animations. No matter how dated, I still love the graphics of this game and they quite frankly look amazing to me, even if it doesn't look like a modern triple A game.As for my complaints, I have almost none. The only thing I can say that annoyed me was the AI of your squad as they would often get in the way and make it hard to move around at times. Everything else about this game makes up for it 10 times over though, so it's easily overlookable.Overall I really enjoyed this game and would EXTREMELY recommend it to anyone looking for a very well done sci-fi action game.10/10 one of my favorite games and among the best I have played.

content:
, 2013
												I consider Half-Life 2 to be one of the best single player first person shooters ever created.  At the time of release it was groundbreaking and almost a decade later there are still few FPS out there that can stand up to it.  The level design, the immersive atmosphere, the innovative use of physics, the graphics (which still hold up), the structure, the pacing, the characters, the story, the weapons...all are exceptional.  It's a game that can be played over and over.  One negative would be the AI which was decent at the time but feels a little dated now.  That's a minor gripe.  An almost perfect game.

content:
8, 2015
												This game is no doubt a masterpiece. When I initially played this game a long time ago, I didn't like it. I thought it was just a generic sci fi FPS with a mediocre story. After giving this game another go years later, I finally understand this game. There is far more to Half-Life 2 if you're willing to dig a little deeper. The entire game manages to create this very surreal and mysterious atmosphere that really creates a very unique tone. The level design is fantastic. It manages to guide you through nonlinear areas without giving you a map or checkpoints. The characters are all very distinct and interesting. Each character contributes to the game in very idiosyncratic ways. Every aspect of this game seems to come together to create a very peculiar effect that matches nothing I've ever seen before. Half-Life 2 is a very fine example as to how video games are an art and have the ability to evoke meaningful and thought provoking feelings.

content:
2014
												Best Game of 2004. Even better than the first HL, wow I didn't think it was possible. While it is a shooter, it involves a lot more gameplay types, it allows you to drive through to point A-B with intense action, areas where you need to sneak past, you get to control troops of rebels (and even antlions at one point). And the regular shooting is great, it's also a true sequel meaning it's just a bunch of higher tech HL. (with the same physics puzzles and similar gameplay) It also has one of the best sci-fi storyline's of the century, including characters, dialog, and of course just story in general. It introduces a new gun that is just OMG, try launching a paint can at something, see how much damage that will cause. Just amazing, like HL1, I really have NOTHING negative to say.Rated: 10/10

content:
, 2012
												The game changer. The bar to which all other FPS's should judge themselves and be judged by.Upon it's release Half Life 2 was cutting edge, not just for a follow up FPS, but for games in general.Graphics and set peices that hold up even now, 8 years on from it's release.Gravity effects, AI that flanks, nades, covers and changes their behavior seeds with every load and save made.Topped off with totally immersive story and charcters, a must for any dystopian/ Orwellian fan. After opening a portal to another world at the Black Mesa research facility in Half Life, the Earth came to the attention of an all powerful Alien force, who after brushing aside all of the worlds defences in the '7 hour war' have now enslaved humanity and are slowy draining the planet of all its' natural resorces.Order is maintainted via a 'combine' military force of half alien half human hybrids that have grouped up the remaining human kind into large rundown numbered Citys."Wake up and smell the ashes"

												Half-Life 2: Deathmatch brings back the adrenaline pumped feeling from old Deathmatch classics such as Unreal tournament and Quake. With improved graphics, physics and a combination of the half-life 2 story this game is filled with rush. content:
ber 8, 2016
												Great game, revolutionary in its time, my only qualms with it are as follows:Chapter 1: Point Insertion was and is still my favourite chapter of this game, I feel it wasn't focused on enough, don't get me wrong, it's so sublimnal, so detailed, to the point of perfection.  I just feel this should of be its own game, never to be I guess. (HL2RP exists though)Combine radio chatter very hard to hear, I think they should make it louder for the sake of hearing.I wish the games chapters had less time spent alone, more time with a companion i.e Barney, or a Rebel.  It seems like it would of added quite a bit more depth and story expostion time to the game.More speeches from Breen, not enough to go around!
